alert.note: Alert for Chattahoochee; Muscogee (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 19 at 2:55PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Muscogee and Chattahoochee Counties through 330 PM EDT... At 254 PM EDT, a line of strong thunderstorms was along a line extending from near Carter Acres to Custer Road Terrace to near Jamestown/south Fort Benning, and moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Columbus, Cusseta, North Fort Benning, Bibb City, Fort Benning/lawson Army Air Fld, Saint Marys Hills, Edgewood, Highland Park, Laurel Hills, Christopher, Sand Hill, Battle Park, Vista Terrace, Columbus Metropolitan Airport, Jamestown/south Fort Benning, Rose Hill, Manta, Kenwood, Custer Road Terrace and Benning Hills. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
